nodes.title: II.2. Superficial structures: Primarily funerary superstructure
Funerary Structure FS2
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS2 (5.4 m x 5.4 m) is a partly intact quadrate enclosure whose perimeter walls are composed of larger uncut stones (up to 90 cm long) (58.172΄ / 01.640΄ / 4560 m). Virtually no coherent wall fragments are left. The remaining in situ stones are even with the ground surface or project above it to a maximum height of 25 cm.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS3 (3.2 m x 3.6 m) is a double-course quadrate enclosure aligned in the cardinal directions (58.054΄ / 01.818΄ / 4530 m). Most of the stones in the outer courses of the perimeter walls have disappeared, while the inner courses are largely intact. Variable-length (20 cm to 75 cm long) stones were used to construct he enclosure walls. These stones are even with the ground surface or project above it to a maximum height of 20 cm.
